perturbation.original_text: The Contract hereof executed between ECOPETROL and the SENDER shall be comprised by these General Clauses and by the Specific Conditions  subscribed by the Parties. All current legal provisions shall apply thereto and therefore the Parties are obliged to fulfill them regardless of whether  or not they are stated in this document or in the Specific Conditions.    PARTIES: The Parties of the Contract shall be: ECOPETROL S A, hereinafter ECOPETROL, a company of mixed economy, authorized by law 1118  of 2006, attached to the Ministry of Mines and Energy, acting pursuant to its by-laws with its main domicile in Bogotá D C with Tax ID 899.999.068- 1, represented by whoever subscribes the Specific Conditions of the Contract and the SENDER, identified as indicated in the Specific Conditions,  who is obliged subject to the conditions and terms set forth herein.    ECOPETROL and the SENDER may also be called in this Shipment Contract or "Contract", individually as the "Party" or jointly as the "Parties".
perturbation.changed_text: The Contract hereof executed between ECOPETROL and the SENDER shall be comprised by these General Clauses and by the Specific Conditions  subscribed by the Parties. All current legal provisions shall apply thereto and therefore the Parties are obliged to fulfill them regardless of whether  or not they are stated in this document or in the Specific Conditions.    PARTIES: The Parties of the Contract shall be: ECOPETROL S A, hereinafter ECOPETROL, a company of mixed economy, authorized by law 1118  of 2006, attached to the Ministry of Mines and Energy, acting pursuant to its by-laws with its main domicile in Bogotá D C with Tax ID 899.999.068- 1, represented by whoever subscribes the Specific Conditions of the Contract and the SHIPPER, identified as indicated in the Specific Conditions,  who is obliged subject to the conditions and terms set forth herein. perturbation.explanation: Interchanging 'SENDER' with 'SHIPPER' causes confusion because the contract inconsistently refers to Solana Petroleum Exploration Colombia Limited as both SENDER and SHIPPER, leading to uncertainty regarding which party bears the responsibilities assigned to each term. This could lead to disputes regarding performance and liability.

perturbation.original_text: 1.3 The scope of the obligations of ECOPETROL is limited to the reception, custody, shipment, decanting, and indispensable storage for the  transportation and shipment of Crude to the SENDER.    1.4 The Contract hereof does not include the provision of the unloading service in unloading areas, the treatment of crudes, the storage in  export terminals, or any terminal services. It is the responsibility of the SENDER to execute or contract these services whenever it may be  necessary. The SENDER shall wave and hold ECOPETROL harmless for any damage or prejudice suffered by ECOPETROL as a result of  failing to receive the Crude in the Exit Point, either by lack of the services before mentioned or by failing to provide the appropriate  facilities for such purpose.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.3 The scope of the obligations of ECOPETROL is limited to the reception, custody, shipment, decanting, and indispensable storage for the  transportation and shipment of Crude to the SHIPPER.    1.4 The Contract hereof does not include the provision of the unloading service in unloading areas, the treatment of crudes, the storage in  export terminals, or any terminal services. It is the responsibility of the SENDER to execute or contract these services whenever it may be  necessary. perturbation.explanation: Changing 'SENDER' to 'SHIPPER' in section 1.3 creates confusion by implying that ECOPETROL's obligations are tied to a different party, while section 1.4 holds 'SENDER' responsible. This inconsistency raises questions about which entity is entitled to receive transportation services, leading to potential contractual breaches.

perturbation.original_text: 2.1.1. Transportation Agreement or Transportation Contract: means the agreement between the Transporter and a Sender whose purpose is the  Transportation of Crude Oil through the Pipeline.     2.1.2. Operating agent or agent: means any natural or legal person, public or private person involved the technical and/or commercial relations for  the provision of Transportation services of Crude Oil through Pipelines.     2.1.3. Water and sediment: means any material coexisting with Crude Oil without being part of the same.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1.1. Transportation Agreement or Transportation Contract: means the agreement between the Pipeline Operator and a Shipper whose purpose is the  Transportation of Crude Oil through the Pipeline.     2.1.2. Operating agent or agent: means any natural or legal person, public or private person involved the technical and/or commercial relations for  the provision of Transportation services of Crude Oil through Pipelines.     2.1.3. Water and sediment: means any material coexisting with Crude Oil without being part of the same.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Transporter' to 'Pipeline Operator' and 'Sender' to 'Shipper' introduces undefined terms that conflict with their established use elsewhere in the contract and manual. This makes it unclear who the parties to the agreement are, creating ambiguity regarding rights and obligations, especially in situations involving liability and indemnification.
